channel.title: Recognizing speech without a UI – Politepix

item.title: Recognizing speech without a UI
item.dc:creator: zch
item.description: I’d like to recognize speech as a background task and launch the UI when a certain word is spoken. Is this something that OpenEars and the iOS framework allow for?

item.title: Reply To: Recognizing speech without a UI
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Welcome,

Meaning that you want the app to be backgrounded, or that you want an app without a visual UI?

item.title: Reply To: Recognizing speech without a UI
item.dc:creator: zch
item.description: Correct Halle. I want my app to be running all the time in the background and listening on the mic. When a particular word is spoken, I’d like the background task to launch the app’s UI.

item.title: Reply To: Recognizing speech without a UI
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: OK, thanks for clarifying. This isn’t something I actively support (meaning it isn’t in my testbed and I don’t provide API for it or present it as a feature, so if it changes between OS versions I can’t extend a ton of help with that) but some people have gotten it working. Search around these forums for the keyword “background” and you should find some information on the details.
